body_html:
Also, the GPU implementation uses cuSOLVER to compute the eigendecomposition (in particular, the cusolverDn<t>syevd() family of routines).

I have read and personally experienced that not all cuSOLVER routines have better performance than CPU counterparts. For example, the cusolverDn<t>gesvd() family of routines were not performance-competitive with MKL, but existed mainly for platforms where MKL might not be available, and for interface compatibility: https://devtalk.nvidia.com/default/topic/830894/cusolverdncgesvd-performance-vs-mkl/

Does anybody know if the cusolverDn<t>syevd() family of routines have competitive performance?
